title: Calories in Pilaf Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in pilaf rice per 100 g, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium from broth, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Vegetable pilaf rice cooked in broth with onions, carrots, and a bit of oil; no meat or nuts added.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, brand of rice/broth, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of pilaf rice provides ~150 kcal, mostly from carbs with some added fat from cooking oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 50 g cooked chicken per 100 g rice
Use plain boiled rice (no oil or broth)
Include 20 g almonds for nutty pilaf

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of pilaf rice?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for vegetable pilaf rice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in pilaf rice?
faqs.a: Around 28 g carbs per 100 g, with 1.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is pilaf rice higher in calories than plain rice?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added oil and broth; plain rice is ~110 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in pilaf rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 300 mg per 100 g from the broth used in cooking.

faqs.q: Can I make low-calorie pilaf rice?
faqs.a: Yes, use low-sodium broth and minimal oil to reduce calories to ~120 kcal per 100 g.
